Sunday morning ten A M but last night's party was still in full swing drink? My mate Suzie asked handing me a glass of cider Thanks I grinned

what the fuck is the matter with this kid? Look I'm not kidding I just got money and saw neighbour he invited me in and I thought what the hell? Five minutes we sat down and he offered me a smoke on some herbal weed legal high well I had a bad one and had a bad trip for ages and couldn't talk or stand up four people watched me by the way as I ended up looking like I need sectioning so when so so when I got home I was going to text you and threw up a lot I've been back and told him that that shit is dangerous I'm so sorry for this I'm so pissed off for trying it I thought it would do nothing at all yes I would like to as soon as I sort myself out a bit if that's okay all of the above is the truth this kid is fucked in the head genuinely genuinely fucked in the head so he's gone next door had a bit of pot it's affected him really badly so he's gone home been sick hasn't thought to text me during any of this it fucks me off cos I'm not his girlfriend I'm not his wife I'm not gonna sit around making him dinner
so but I mean that that is a very very far-fetched story like if you were gonna make up a lie you'd go with something more plausible than that

the guy that he was waiting home so that the guy who he's been doing a job for this week can come round and pay him fine

you might have to come in the car so I don't murder him

I'll tell I'll c I'll come in twenty Right she er she lived just around the corner from the house I shared with my mum older brother and younger sister so it was nice to get invited to the party though I wasn't really dressed for it I was wearing demin shorts and a stripey vest top and I had my shoulder-length brown hair up in a ponytail picture the scene

note that and spent lots of time putting it into different styles whereas most of us just you know leave it
but now Music Channel was on the TV playing chart songs and about twenty people were sitting and drinking and laughing

I don't really understand the link between the hair-doing

Cos 's not having any cos he can fuck off
mm Oh it's good it's not um sometimes the cheese that you get when they make ham is really smoky
it's alright isn't it um music Channel yes twenty people laughing
it had clearly been a good night everyone was in high spirits I squashed myself onto her cream leather sofa and got chatting to some mates
I knew most of the people there some better than others but as the drink flowed I relaxed and started to have a laugh ten AM there was just one guy

who I wasn't sure about I'd met him a couple of times and he'd always been okay with me but today he seemed to be taking pleasure in teasing me everything I said he'd make some kind of quip at my expense then everyone laughing
how old is she? Have we has she told us yet?
she hasn't told us yet has she

everything I said he'd make some kind of quip sorry I'm just messing about he said when I looked hurt it's alright I slurred ten AM it was afternoon now and a steady flow of booze was starting to get the better of me feeling drowsy I curled up on the sofa and fell asleep I'm not sure how long I lay snoozing good word the next thing I was aware of was springing awake are you scared?

I'd been yanked t to consciousness by a searing burning sensation around my face and hand a second later fully awake I realized what was happening my hair was on fire I lept to my feet but people were laughing cackling at me in a heart-thumping panic not understanding what had happened or why no one was helping I stumbled out of the room flailing my hands wildly trying to put out the flames on her head I ran out into the street screaming mum I wanted her because as frantic as I was I realized someone must've done this to me deliberately the flames were out as I ran blindly towards our house dialling mum's number someone set me on fire I wailed I'm coming home I was so hysterical I couldn't hear what she said in reply um you're a fucking madwoman what the hell are you talking about?
so she didn't put herself out? She rung her mum?
she rang her mum yeah she didn't call nine one one

not nine nine nine er he's put both Cos I said er yes to the lift? Or yes you're a douche? I'll be there in twenty um and by now an intense pain was making my hands throb would you not just go to the sink and put your head in the sink?
first bit of water you'd be there
whether it's just a sink in there or even a toilet if it comes to it you'd put your head in that
get someone to pee on you almost home I bumped into a neighbour walking his dogs what happened ? He gasped well you wouldn't would you because your head's on fire

so the fact that your head's on fire probably tells people that you can't really stop and chat I woke up and I was on fire I sobbed I had no idea what my hair looked like but my hands were red and starting to blister I suppose she was trying to put it out with her hands grabbing his phone he called nine nine nine better than she did

minutes later a police car and an ambulance arrived my mum came running out too oh my God she shouted what have they done to you? Everyone was laughing mum I sobbed the pain in my hands now unbearable paramedics covered them in a kind of gel then got me into the ambulance with mum too they gave me gas and air on the way to the hospital but it didn't really touch the excruciating pain I was still drunk and having been suddenly wrenched from my slumber it all felt unreal like a nasty dream but at the hospital a doctor told me I'd suffered very very real second degree burns to my hands arm and shoulder they gave me pain relief my hands were so swollen they had to cut my rings off and then carefully bandage me up huh will she be scarred? Mum asked I'm afraid so the doctor replied she may need skin grafts in the future too we both cried why did they do this to you? Mum wept I shrugged too upset to talk none of this made any sense one minute I'd been drinking and having fun the next I'd woken up on fire I'd been so confused I didn't even know who'd done this to me
whoever it was had shaved part of my right eyebrow off too
only part of it I didn't know until
mum told me in the hospital you wouldn't tell her
by the way you've only got half a right eyebrow
in the grand scheme of things

back at home I looked at myself in my bedroom mirror and broke down one side of my hair had burned almost to the scalp and my singed ponytail had been cut off I look a mess I sobbed it'll grow back mum soothed hugging me later texted me to ask me how I was
what the hell was wrong with ? Some mate she was

she was probably off shagging someone later texted me yeah and I replied telling her how I was upset and badly burned I felt very angry she hadn't tried to help me that night the panic I'd experienced waking up on fire kept surging back and disturbing my sleep the next day the police came and took a statement they promised to find who'd done this to me I hoped that they would because I wanted them to be punished for leaving me like this not only was I scarred for life I was also too scared to go out I couldn't even face going to college and my hand was too badly injured to hold a pen anyway under the bandages my skin was raw and weeping

bleurgh a few weeks on the police told me it was the guy who'd been teasing me who'd set me ablaze he used a cigarette lighter to ignite an aerosol can next to your head as you slept and walked away as the flames spread what the fuck?

it was done as a prank the laughter I'd heard that day echoed in my ears it's a pretty sick prank I spat bitterly had been charged with causing grievous bodily harm but he was denying being the prankster so there'd be a trial and I'd have to give evidence the thought of standing in court and relivi reliving what happened terrified me when the day arrived six months later I asked to stand behind a screen to give my evidence that way I didn't have to face the person who'd done this to me bit cowardy but fine

it also stopped everyone else staring at me although I'd had extensions put in my hair so no one could see where it had been burnt I was still self-conscious about my hands which while healed were covered in red scars the jury at Preston coun Crown Court heard that among Stockell and his mates there was a culture of playing pranks when they were drinking like shaving off people's eyebrows
yeah not setting people on fire

with an aerosol frig but I'd not been a part of it and it was no excuse for what he'd done to me well it's no excuse anyway his defence barrister told the court that a scaffolder had been drinking heavily that weekend he said what he'd done wasn't bullying it was horse-play but thankfully the jury found him guilty sentencing him to nine months in prison the judge said what he'd done had gone beyond a practical joke I wasn't in court but police called me to tell me the result and while I was glad he was being punished nine months didn't seem like enough my injuries were already bad but if I hadn't woken up when I did I dread to think how much worse they could've been now three months on my hair's grown back and although the burns have healed I still can't close my right hand properly I've also been left with lumpy scarring on both hands

the hospital specialist was given has given me special cream to try and reduce the scarring but I may need plastic surgery if they don't work I've started to go out recently but only with a small group of close friends and no one who was at the house party because they stood and laughed while set my hair on fire and as well as the scars the fear and humiliation of that will stay with me forever
often they have a statement from the person um sadly
oh mm tut look at the state of you mum
you do look pretty bad mum
Is that not a staged photo though? Someone has just put a bottle of vodka next to someone who's sleeping
uh s why would you spell with two Ms?
mm 's no 's daughter took this photo to try to save her
would it work? I don't think so
my eyes opened then n then narrowed to slits
burned by the shock of the daylight
my head was thundering with pain and I could smell vomit you know the day's not gonna start well
yep there was a figure looming over me I knew it must be my fifteen-year-old daughter oh so this is mum this is mum
she was the only one who ever visited me these days look at you you're a state she yelled just stop drinking
I don't want to bury you mum
I love it how the way it's written like a soap opera
I was still too drunk to say a word and was right I was killing myself with the alcohol I just didn't know how to stop mum needs to man up
ten years oh ten years earlier
maybe we'll find she's traumatized ten years earlier my life had been unrecognizable I'd had a lovely three bedroom home in

yes three bedroom home in with my husband a good job managing care homes and three beautiful children nine six and three-year-old was from my previous relationship but was raising him as his own family life was organized chaos camping holidays and cup-cake baking marathons and every s sunny weekend we had a splashathon in the kids' paddling pool

Good times but then two things collided I had a disease of the here we go I had a disease of the hip joints that caused me constant pain and I was signed off work I was then it was then that the my dad dies of cancer I became depressed and I started rowing and then the fatal thing happened the thing that ruined my life I started drinking to block everything out
yeah it wasn't you that ruined your life it was the booze
no yeah I mean that all is bad really
people get through a lot worse
yeah I thought it helped I'd always liked an odd beer but suddenly that beer became a bottle of sherry yeah I can see how
is your name Dot Cotton though? Sherry?
Sherry One bottle of beer becomes one bottle of sherry
yep I sipped glass after glass of it in front of the telly until the bottle was empty and I was in a stupor
eventually and I split up no wonder he's now married to a booze-hound
and failure heaped on top of depression I started drinking three three this is more like it now

I started drinking three litre bottles of cider until they were empty too I'd lie on the sofa and binge for days ending up slurring stumbling and incapable I had to allow neighbours to take the kids to school for me when was thirteen ten and seven came and took them to live with him close by it was obvious I was in no fit state to look after them
yeah I think er the bottles of cider
mm yeah I mean maybe at thir er at thirteen might've liked it but even then I think it's probably a bit young
Don't think it's good parenting necessarily
Good parenting er one day one day
I collapsed at home unconscious and spent two weeks in a coma in hospital
from the three bottles of cider I'm not fucking
yep when I woke up the doctor told me why it's liver damage he said oh and look she's there
has she got any liver left?
you've got five years left you have to stop drinking it scared me into doing just that wow
but it was an alcoholic and er I was an alcoholic and a few months on the urge became too strong and I started boozing again
are you gonna eat this love?
it's it's tough cos you've got no one in your life
no I mean she's drunk them all away
what's happened here? I mean she's in a bit of a something over there hang on we're not there yet
er du du du du du now here I was a year later it was pure vodka that ran in my blood
Three litres was my standard binge
standard binge I'd simply lie down on the sofa in my pyjamas sick bucket at my side
and drink until I hit oblivion h so she's prepared that she's gonna be sick from the alcohol and she's just gonna keep going
mm body can't take it three litres of vodka a day?
